Plot and Animate Power Sensitivity Analysis

Source: R/plot_power_sensitivity.R
plot_power_sensitivity.Rd

Calls analyze_power_sensitivity, transforms the data, and generates two static ggplot objects (P_dyn vs VDD, P_dyn vs Freq), saving each one to a separate PDF file. Also generates two animated MP4 videos showing the sensitivity.

plot_power_sensitivity(
  alpha_fixed,
  C_L_fixed,
  V_DD_range,
  f_range,
  base_output_filename_base = "power_sensitivity"
)

Arguments

alpha_fixed

The fixed average switching activity factor.

C_L_fixed

The fixed total load capacitance (in Farads, F).

V_DD_range

A numeric vector of supply voltage values (in Volts, V) to test.

f_range

A numeric vector of clock frequency values (in Hertz, Hz) to test.

base_output_filename_base

The base path and filename (e.g., "sensitivity_") The function will append "_VDD.pdf", "_Freq.pdf", "_VDD.mp4", and "_Freq.mp4". Standardly, it is "power_sensitivity"

Value

A list containing the two ggplot objects and the two gganimate objects (also saves PDF and MP4 files).

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
VDDs <- seq(0.8, 1.2, length.out = 10)
Freqs <- seq(0.5e9, 2.5e9, length.out = 10) # Augmenté le nombre de points pour meilleure animation
sensitivity_outputs <- plot_power_sensitivity(0.15, 60e-12, VDDs, Freqs)
} # }
